Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides support to defray expenses of participants in the May 23-27, 2011 workshop on Ergodic Theory to be held in Orsay, France.
The purpose of this international conference is to bring together researchers in Ergodic Geometry, an area which has seen recent important developments where ergodic ideas and points of view are used in other parts of mathematics. The aim of the workshop is to make progress on the core theory while at the same time expanding applications.

The workshop will bring together both an international group consisting of experienced and junior researchers, including graduate students, and postdocs to discuss recent work and advances. For graduate students, postdoctoral fellows and junior faculty this should serve as a springboard for their future in the professions. Priority for funding will be given to graduate students, other young researchers and participants without other support as well as members of groups underrepresented in mathematics

POR.DRECONTENT:
From May 23 to May27, 2011, was held in Orsay (France) an International Conference in Mathematics on "Ergodic Geometry". The aim of the conference was to present the state of the art on a very active topic of research in Pure Mathematics. 

Most of the world leaders in the domain were present and there were twenty plenary talks. The closing plenary talk was delivered By Elon Lindenstrauss, from the Hebrew University in Jerusalem,  Fields Medal 2010. The support of the  NSF award  allowed fourteen young researchers, graduate students or post-doctoral faculty working in the U.S. to participate. They could, and they did,  meet and discuss  among themselves, with other Professors from the U.S. and from abroad and with the many other young researchers from Europe and from Israel. The many personal contacts were facilitated by the location on the same campus with common coffee breaks and buffet style lunches outside. From the reactions of the beneficiaries, they indeed found in this conference a source of new ideas and of fruitful contacts. 

Each of the recipients was refunded a  transatlantic flight at the lowest rate and a modest hotel room. Most of the other expenses were covered by other sources or by personal funds.
